name: State_15

timeline_beats.label: Founding fishing hamlets coalesce into chartered coastal polity
Integration into River-Kingdoms & Leagues trade networks
Age of Flux: fortified ports and privateer rise
Present Order consolidation; codified maritime statutes

factions.label: Tide-Clan Confederation
factions.influence_hint: Local coastal communities; seasonal fishing rights

factions.label: Harbor Council (urban oligarchy)
factions.influence_hint: Urban trade policy and treaty negotiators

factions.label: Saltwardens & Reagent Merchants
factions.influence_hint: Monopoly on imported ritual reagents and saltworks

traits: oral navigational songs (keepers of local charts)
practical syncretism of ritual and craft

constraints: No instant resurrection or true life-replacement magics
Long-range mind influence is rare and institutionally banned
Navigational auguries cannot replace charts and seamanship
Ritual magic consumes scarce imported reagents or specialized labor
Combustion-derived industry limited (no high-pressure steam megatechs)
Obligations under alliance A3 and treaty T4 must be respected
notes: Ports tightly controlled by Maritime Guild; access tied to guild seats
Economy dependent on steady import of ritual reagents; Saltwardens gatekeep supply
Seasonal monsoon patterns dictate major sailing windows and legal voyage seasons
Local navigational knowledge transmitted orally; charts are politically sensitive
Privateering legacy creates ambiguous maritime law enforcement in Outer Isles
